intro: Rinorea bussei, commonly known as the red-veined stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its biennial growth habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with distinctive red veins and produces small, inconspicuous flowers. It contains irritant chemicals in its stinging hairs, similar to other members of its family. Rinorea bussei is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
